Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. validation.validation: You can only use the From value, [From], on 1 tier.
You can only use the To value, [To], on 1 tier.
From value [From] overlaps with the values on another tier.
To value [To] overlaps with the values on another tier.
All rule breaks must have contiguous ranges. There is a gap after the tier ending with To value [To]. The break step between each tier must be [break].
You can only enter Break Range Units 'Begin Range Units [begin]' and 'End Range Units [end]' when you enter Units or Hours as the Billing Rate Break Type.
You can only enter Break Range Amounts 'Begin Range Amount [begin]' and 'End Range Amount [end]' when you enter Amount as the Billing Rate Break Type.
The To value must be greater than 0.
The To value must be greater than 0.
Specify a Percent for the Percent billing rate adjustment type. You can't specify an Amount for this adjustment type.
Specify an Amount for the Rate Override billing rate adjustment type. You can't specify a Percent for this adjustment type.
The rule must have 1 tier that starts from zero.
Enter a Cap Amount or Cap Hours greater than zero.
Rule Breaks only allowed for Tiered Rule Types.
The worktag type for the Daily Rate Transaction Grouping isn’t valid.
The dimension selection requires Daily Rate Transaction Grouping setup.
The dimension selection requires Daily Rate Transaction Grouping setup.
The dimension selection requires Daily Rate Transaction Grouping setup.
You can only enter an Item specifying an Expense Item or Purchase Item for the Misc Expense Rule Type.
You can only enter an Item specifying an Expense Item for the Expense Rule Type.
You can't enter a Project Role for the Misc Expense Rule Type.
You can only enter an Item for the Expense or Misc Expense Rule Type.
You have to enter an adjustment type.
If you specify a Revenue Adjustment Reason, the daily rate must be 'False'.
validation.description: You can't specify a Revenue Adjustment Reason for a daily rate. You can either change Is Daily Rate to 'False' and keep the reason, or remove the reason and resubmit the contract rate sheet.

Specify an Amount for the Rate Override billing rate adjustment type. You can't specify a Percent for this adjustment type.
Specify a Percent for the Percent billing rate adjustment type. You can't specify an Amount for this adjustment type.

To set up Time Definitions, your Unit of Time must be Days.
You can select only one max tier.
If Is Daily Rate is true, you must include Time Definitions. If Is Daily Rate is false, the Time Definitions must be empty.
If you enter a Project Billing Rate Sheet, Is Daily Rate must be empty.
